Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - very patchy service”
Reviews.Author: kemback
Reviews.Content: Wildly expensive, but very beautiful hotel in a great location. Too bad they spoil it all by some really patchy service - the bar area is just wrecked by staff who have their heads down and have no interest in taking a look at guests waiting patiently to be served. For these prices, it should all be perfect but sadly this is not the case.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Opulence”
Reviews.Author: Maxabillion
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, glamorous and spotless. Although considered one of the "great old hotels" it is in pristine condition. The rooms are surprisingly large and the bathrooms are enormous and extravagant. The positive reviews this Hotel has received are deserved. You clearly don't come here to save money.....you come here for a slice of heaven. Some suggest that the service is not 5-star quality but it is definitely 5-star Paris. Restaurant le Meurice is an experience unto itself and the hotel bar is very comfortable and inviting. The junior suites are definitely worth the upgrade. When traveling to Paris....why not.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is Enhanced Through Le Meurice”
Reviews.Author: dennisglobal
Reviews.Content: Earlier this month I spent 4 nights at the Le Meurice in Paris. I finally found a bath tub that had adequate size. Most hotels around the world seem to be shrinking the size of their bathtubs and I loved the fact that Le Meurice, had good nice, large bathtubs that I could enjoy. The rooms too were generous with space and I appreciated that. Of course the flavour of the hotel is traditional and the decor is in keeping with that; but for me it completely enhanced my experience of Paris. Paris came alive for me as I stayed at Le Meurice. Their in room dining was superlative and so was their check in and check out process. The challenging parts were - concierge, not stepping out of their way to respond to questions and the lack of a proper business centre in the hotel - its difficult to call one 28 inch mac with a printer and some prepaid card (felt really stupid using a prepaid card in a top five star hotel) to connect to the internet. Of course I had to do that because I needed print outs; but otherwise you can connect from your room. I have still not at all understood why top luxury hotels do not offer WiFi connectivity free of charge - it beats me. Outside of that, I loved the experience at Le Meurice and would definitely me visiting again...hopefully concierge is more helpful this time to his Indian brother -:)

Reviews.Title: “Rob the piggy bank...”
Reviews.Author: FussyFred
Reviews.Content: Large rooms are hard to find in Paris, everything is usually pretty pokey. However...Le Meurice is different. Not only were the rooms generous, the quality was first rate. The bathrooms are beautifully fiited out with massive baths and separate showers in marble-clad cubicles. The whole room was excellent. The service was reasonably smiley which I suppose passes for great in Paris! The location was excellent. 5 mins to Champs D'Elysee, 10 mins to Notre Dame and right next door to Le Louvre and the gardens. We loved it and would recommend the hotel to anyone...but...be prepared to rob the kids' piggy banks! The upper reaches of 'expensive' is how we would describe the room rates and food. Still...if you've got it...

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: -nesnoosa-
Reviews.Content: Not only are you in the center of a beautiful shopping district, you are also home with one of the top rated restaurants in Paris, and close to everything you need, espeically if you are site seeing! Best bedrooms in Parisian hotels in terms of traditional style and space. The double doors to keep the sound out are incredible if you are a light sleeper! And the bathrooms are well separated from the main rooms. The only thing I would say could improve, is the service of the staff, they always seem too busy to help, from the receptionists to the porters... even when taking a wedding dress out of the limo taxi right outside...! Breakfast is a treat, and if you can... I would highly recommend eating at Restaurant le Meurice, it is out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place in paris”
Reviews.Author: Karen_Singh82
Reviews.Content: Been to Paris many times, this is my favorite hotel, great location, great service and beautiful room. Seems expensive butfir the size of room and amenities you get well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious First Class Decadence”
Reviews.Author: WineAndBacon
Reviews.Content: Le Meurice is a beautiful place! You do get what you pay for, pure decadence! Fantastic staff welcoming and charming. Every room in this hotel is beautiful and every morning at breakfast you feel transported back to another place and time. Its magnificent. The room was on the 6th floor with a view of the rooftops and it was so beautiful and romantic. Lovely room, everything was perfect. The ONLY flaw in this magnificent hotel was the concierge. We found the concierge service was not up to par with 5 star service at all. We stayed 6 nights and called down often to have them make us restaurant reservations and not once were they helpful in picking a place for us. We would have to use this site to look at reviews etc and them give them a list to call for us. There was also an incident when we were at the desk asking them to book a car for us and the concierge dialed the phone for us and handed it to us to do it ourselves. Again, not the kind of concierge service for a hotel of this caliber. Other then that everything was perfect. Bar 228 at night is AMAZING, don't pass up a raspberry bellini from the fabulous bartenders. I can't wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service - Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LarKir
Reviews.Content: The Meurice is a pricey hotel, but I found the service from start to finish absolutely first class. No request went unanswered and in every case was dealt with extremely promptly. Room was excellent and exactly as we had requested, overlooking the Tuileries Gardens, with a bright and spacious bathroom. Food in Dali's restaurant superb and the ambience in the bar was great. Really could not fault it. Expensive but in every respect worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Porthos77
Reviews.Content: My stay at Le Meurice was marred by the poor concierge service. I had asked for help making reservations for several very popular restaurants in Paris. I was told by the concierge that these restaurants only accepted reservations 30 days in advance. Knowing this was not true, I called myself and was able to secure reservations 60 days in advance. Had I waited 30 days, I would never have been able to secure those reservations and a good part of my vacation compromised. I had initially posted a review about this, management responded and promised to make my stay at Le Meurice an unforgettable one. My stay was very pleasant, the room was nice, the location was pretty much unbeatable. Service was acceptable but not something you'd find at a true 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Has become my favourite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: titiparis01
Reviews.Content: Great location, superb renovation and perfect staff. This is all of what you expect from a palace. The rooms are just very elegant with this french baroque feel that we all love. The bar is very nice and offers top Champagne. Have not tried the restaurant but will definitively stay there next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Among the Nicer Paris Hotel; Nice Blend of Modern Juxtaposed on Traditional”
Reviews.Author: Globetrekker63
Reviews.Content: Struggled whether to rate this hotel 4 or 5 stars. Good location, though Rue de Rivoli is hardly among Paris' more attractive streets. The Starck designed lobby is brilliant- very nice take on traditional, and making it thoroughly modern. Rooms are modern traditional, but very fresh and updated to a very high standard. Excellent bathroom. Service was "proper" in that very French way- not rude, but lacking any warmth or sincerity, and generally quite polite (however, the person who escorted me to my table at breakfast was rather grumpy). Flight arrived early, so I checked in late morning- I totally accept that the front desk has the right to ask me to come back later at check-in time - that said, there were serial "your room will be ready in 20 more minutes", and by the fourth time, that became tiring (plus a waste of my time- I could have gone and done other things)- speaks to service execution that is not perfect, which it should be for a hotel of this quality- thus my 4 star rating. Would love to go back to this hotel, and be convinced that it should be rated 5 stars. I will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Finest hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Robert Townsend
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Meurice Hotel more than 25 times, and if you want old world charm with modern amenities, this is the place. The service is as good as service can be, and the food is excellent. But be aware, it is very expensive. As an international lawyer I travel on an expense account, and this is precisely what you need if you spend much time in this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “restaurant and bar.”
Reviews.Author: hardwear
Reviews.Content: 18 euros for a btl of beer,vodka starting at 22euro and upwards seems outlandish even for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Divine Opulence”
Reviews.Author: Joe L
Reviews.Content: My partner and I both enjoy Paris so much. We have had the pleasure of staying in many different hotels though the years and were pleasantly surprised with our experience at Le Meurice. The location of course is perfect, our room had a beautiful view of the Eiffel Tour and the decor, while extremely classic, had a modern twist that made us feel right at home. The beds were extremely comfortable and the sheets and towels were superb. As far as service is concerned, the concierge couldn't have been more helpful with securing our reservations in advance of our arrival at a few obscure restaurants that were recommended by friends who live part time in Paris. Enjoy a nightcap in the bar and take in the beauty of the room.

Reviews.Title: “More expensive than good....”
Reviews.Author: CAIOMEN
Reviews.Content: Nice,but not the best in Paris.I prefer until Ritz Hotel. Breakfast disappointment... Room dificult to climatizate... Reception staff very helpfull and quite gentle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and experience”
Reviews.Author: yetis
Reviews.Content: We took a quick weekend trip to Paris. Took our 5 month old and the hotel staff went out of their way, to make our stay (and his stay) as pleasant as possible. The location is as good as it gets, in central Paris. The hotel itself is traditional in a classic Parisian way, with a stylish edge. The lobby bar and lounge appear to be a bit of awell heeled scene on Saturday afternoon. Our room had a massive, renovated bathroom with one of the best showers I have had in years! The bedroom was pleasant, though not massive, with high ceilings and tastefully decorated. It's not a modern Mandarin or Peninsula, full of all sorts of technology. But that's a goood thing for some. All in all, very positive.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: GJCUK
Reviews.Content: Very hard to fault this place! It was excellent in every detail, from check in to check out. The staff were attentive and welcoming in every area, whether reception, the bars or the restaurants. Perfectly situated for the sights (and shops) of Paris. Some lovely Bistros within easy walk. Too much to explore in a single weekend. When we return to Paris. It will be to Le Meurice without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but worth it - what class!!”
Reviews.Author: Fingus
Reviews.Content: what a classy place - arrived after two long flights and they accommodated me before check-in. Nothing too much trouble for an awesome committed staff. And the bar at night is a real treat!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: FamilyHennessy
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed at Le Meurice in April 2011 and very much enjoyed it. The interiors were beautifully done and the service was very good. The room service was impeccable as two waiters arranged and served us! The main breakfast room was breathtaking. The location opposite the Tuileries was absolutely perfect for the children who couldn't wait to race there after breakfast. It was also nice being close to the Louvre. However, it is a very expensive hotel and I would think there are a lot of other hotels in Paris on par with Le Meurice for that price tag. There were also a few body guards roaming around the lobby and the main bar area which I personally found uncomfortable. Beautiful hotel otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sumptuoustreats
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel which encourages relaxation. The interior is a visual feast, beautifully blended the old style with modern quirky additions a perfect stay for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A haven of peace and beauty”
Reviews.Author: Robin91
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the fourth time in October 2011. The decor in the public areas is stunning and, much overused term, really classy. That is, it is both modern with the Philip Starck design and opulent with just the right amount of Louis 16th gold and mirrors. Staff are very polite, concierge very helpful with bookings before we arrived, rooms continue the opulent theme, food in both restaurants is very good, especially obviously in the gastronomique restaurant which is world class (Euro 950 for two including about Euro 375 on wine and including Euro90 tip). Great location opposite the lovely Tuileries gardens and 5 minutes from the Louvre and the Place Vendome. We have had courtyard rooms which are vey quiet and rather tranquil in the view and also overlooking the Tuileries which are somewhat noisier (the rue de Rivoli is a busy road) but even on the second floor and as light sleepers, we were fine with it. Overall feel inside the hotel is relaxed, luxurious, you feel unhurried and its great. I would recommend this with enthusiasm and unreservedly but two little niggles on the most recent visit- firstly, they were 5% off the pace- rollaway bed was not there on arrival despite being booked in advance and took a few asks before it arrived, the odd chip in the paint, that kind of thing, no big deal but a little off; and secondly, they were a touch sniffy about my wife and child sitting in their lobby restaurant which I am sure is because they wanted the elegant ones only but had to accomodate us as we were hotel guests. Still, its a great hotel.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: BillScurry
Reviews.Content: The Meurice is the gold standard for lodging in Paris, certainly, and most likely beyond. The plant is gorgeous and marvelously appointed, and the service is wonderful and friendly. No one needs me to recommend the two dining rooms -- Le Dali and Le Meurice -- but I will anyway, noting that the experience of eating in both chambers is delightful. My extended family has been staying at the Meurice for 25 years, so my wife and I are happy to be the latest generation benefiting from this great tradition. If you can splurge on a rue Rivoli accommodation, splurge on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and elegant”
Reviews.Author: SamsonNIte
Reviews.Content: After arriving from a grueling long distance flight it was wonderful to enter this elegant haven and relax and be well and truly looked after. Lunch in the dining room is a real treat, with exceptional service, delicious food all served in palatial surrounds. Thought the hotel is a little too formal for my tastes one cannot fail to appreciate the quality and charm of a truly grand and classic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “There are few hotels in the world that outperform expectations - this is one of them”
Reviews.Author: ChDYquem
Reviews.Content: Nothing inspires more than walking into that restaurant and enjoying a meal, this is a unique hotel and probably the finest hotel in the world right now, however it is a close run thing. Unlike so many other members of the Dorchester Group they can cook brilliantly and deliver the finest service. If you want the best, here you are. That said I've spent many happy days in the Plaza Athenee in Paris as the Relais Plaza is so cute and great at what they do. Bravo Paris, if only some London hotels were so good - must try harder London!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel In Paris. Best concierge at All.”
Reviews.Author: sfabiani
Reviews.Content: The concierge find a way To reserve The Best restaurants, bars ans discos In Paris. Hotel tatally renovated. Walking distance from Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch luxury hotel - but...”
Reviews.Author: Timfromsussex
Reviews.Content: Le Meurice is a very sophisticated hotel in a stunning location in Paris. Service excellent and fellow guests a well dressed and classy lot. It exudes style. The bar is excellent and well managed. Eye wateringly expensive of course. So the but... My room faced inwards into the courtyard / lightwell of the hotel. Therefore no natural daylight and you could not really open the curtains as rooms opposite could see in. Lovely bathroom etc but I am afraid it was pretty gloomy and depressing. After a night we managed to move to a smaller room overlooking Tuileries gardens - glorious view (room 607 - recommend for romance - a smallish double bed!). Breakfast - cooked breakfast very slow to arrive and scrmabled eggs really odd and not very nice - tasted like they had semolina in. So - conclusion - ensure you get a room that has natural daylight - do not go if you cannot. Take a newspaper if you want a cooked breakfast! As a couple I reckon I would probably stay at the ritz as a bit more fun and rooms are beautiful - enormous, marvellous swimming pool - downside versus meurice is that downstairs the ritz is rather rambling and lacks the fantatsic meurice lobby where you can people watch. Also ritz is a touch less sophiticated.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: like2travelNY
Reviews.Content: stayed here last march with my teenage daughter. They treated us like royalty and the hotel was completely booked but we still received unbelievable service and attention!

Reviews.Title: “A slice of luxury...with a price to go with!”
Reviews.Author: happyfamilyinnz
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Le Meurice with my husband and 2 small children (6 mo & 2.5 years. Upon check-in we were lucky enough to be upgraded to a larger suite which was lovely with a beautiful view of the louve, the jardin, and eiffel tower. Everything was already set up in our room for our stay - cribs and high chairs - with welcome gifts for the little ones. Every element of our stay was amazing (except the bill at checkout but we knew that was coming). The concierge was attentive - even before we arrived. I had emailed ahead of time to schedule a photographer for a special occasion and they were happy to coordinate. During our stay they had tickets for anything we wanted and a car waiting upon request. We ended up checking out at the end of our scheduled stay only to return to the hotel hours later because we were unable to reach our next destination. The hotel was kind enough to extend our stay the additional night and our rate even though the room was booking for 50% more. What an amazing stay in a beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for everything!”
Reviews.Author: BolderAgent
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at this hotel and it was my 1st trip to Paris. The concierge was terrific in assisting with dinner reservations and the front desk staff in general was incredibly polite if not friendly, and very professional. The location of this hotel was so centrally located and we walked EVERYWHERE, even walked back late night after dinner. Our room was very spacious and the bath was fabulous. It goes without saying, but food and drink is very expensive at the hotel (tea $15 US) but we still enjoyed drinks in the bar, breakfast one morning and tea in the afternoon. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Dogcoat
Reviews.Content: stayed here whilst in Paris with the family, location was perfect, everything is within walking distance. beautiful gardens across the road, park for kids. walk through the park to Louvre, Monument, and up to Champs Alysee Hotel staff were very helpful and polite, never an issue Bedroom was decorated to high standard, though the bed was against the wall which had the corridor on otherside, so when people slammed doors to close, you heard them, but couldn't hear conversations. One point to note, the clock radio was linked to the light switch so when you turn a light switch off at the wall, it turns the clock into energy saving mode, so you cannot see time. Bathroom was big, seperate shower and bath, and seperate room fro toilet, perfect when family with you. Breakfast is served either in restaurant or lounge area, of the 2 found the lounge more informal, and more relaxing for breakfast. Do the restaurant just to be able to see it. Bedroom included robes, slippers, at turn down, no mint but a bottle of water by your bedside table. They have a terrace but this was closed when we were there, it would be fantastic as a late night bar, with views of the eiffell tower, Louvre. Hotels close by are Ritz, Westin, Bristol

Reviews.Title: “Zero service”
Reviews.Author: 2moiavous
Reviews.Content: We came there for some tea and pastries and we expect the same quality standards as Le Bristol or George V. What is our surprise to see that the Tea lounge is sitting right after the entrance ; Extremely dark and no charm. We were standing there for at least 10 mns and no one came to invite us to take a table. Suprisingly the Tea Lounge is not busy as there are still 4 tables free. Lack of experience of 2 young waitors ? We were so disappointed of the quality of service as we left for George V, which is outstanding. Definitely not worthy a second visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: TravelingAgain2011
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 11 days in wonderful Paris, our favorite city. We try to visit it every other year. We have stayed at the Ritz (twice) and at the Jorge V, both lovely hotels, but found the Ritz "stuffy" & although the Jorge V is without question absolutely lovely, I didn't like the location. We like to stay in the 1st. This year we decided to stay at the Meurice hotel because of its great location in the 1st and because friends had stayed here last year & enjoyed their stay. We had booked a "classic" room. We couldn't believe how small it was. We would not have been able to unpack & would have had to "live out of our suitcases". My husband called down to the Reception Desk, spoke to a very helpful gentleman named Stephen, who said he would be happy to show us an "Executive" room & we could move there the next day if we liked it. The "Executive" room was lovely & when we went to pay our bill at the end of our stay, there was no extra cost to us for the upgraded room. All of the staff were wonderful, eager to please and very helpful. The Concierge were great & so helpful. The rooms were immaculately kept & turn down service each night was excellent. There is a great bar in the lobby which we really enjoyed. Everyone there was very pleasant also. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Le Meurice & highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic food, service--some faults”
Reviews.Author: Gandaratravels
Reviews.Content: For me the real draw is the fantastic restaurants, but the hotel is lovely as well. I preferred it before it's make-over when it was just a classic Parisian luxury hotel and the restaurant was 2 stars. I find the new decor silly--takes away from the old spirit but doesn't go far enough to offer something new and wonderful in it's own right. The rooms are still classically sized small as is the lift and fitness room. But are you coming to Paris to work out? Oh, and even though you're paying at least $1,000/night, they charge for wifi. That said, this is a marvelous, magical hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The pinnacle of hospitality”
Reviews.Author: bmatraveler
Reviews.Content: Simply put.... there may be hotels that are as elegant as Le Meurice, but there are no hotels that are more elegant the Le Meurice. The may be places that are as hospitable as Le Meurice, but there are not places that are more hospitable that Le Meurice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the hart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Pipenol
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 2 teenagers for a first visit of Paris. The hotel was wonderfull. The staff very helpfull and personal. We had asked for several specials, as communicating rooms... Everything was perfect at our arriving. The breakfest was served, but very nice for French standards. Again the personel was extra-ordinary, not cool at all, especially toward our teenagers. We had a pass at the bar one evening, where our kids enjoyed surprising non-alcoholic cocktails. The price was correct, for 5 star. I definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Average to disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SFTravelers124
Reviews.Content: Well-located historic hotel. Impressive lobby. Reception excellent. Room recently remodeled, well done. In-room amenities as would be expected in a 5 star hotel. Some issues that one would not expect in this hotel category: They spent the first hour of our stay trying to fix the TV. A lamp did not work. The finally-fixed TV, then had a remote that did not work. Wireless internet spotty in the room. Issues not unique to the Meurice,but also not universal in 5-star hotels: Very "extra" is EXTRAORDINARILY expensive: $6 dollar cokes, $8 snickers bars, $40 breakfasts (for one). At this room rate, I find this cheeky. Issues that should NEVER happen in a hotel in this category: Concierges ALWAYS follow up and don't forget guest requests. We made a reservation request in the morning, and checked back at about 3:30. The concierge at the desk had no record of the request. Less that stellar concierge service in a a 5-star hotel is a deal killer in my opinion. One peculiar one: No top sheets on the beds. just a bottom sheet and a comforter. Not a big deal, but unusual in my experience.

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: EandK1
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Very personalized care. Great location. Not in expensive but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss * * * * *”
Reviews.Author: LelaM
Reviews.Content: THIS is a proper hotel - everything "works". Thanks....

Reviews.Title: “Doing things right”
Reviews.Author: bbffpp
Reviews.Content: First, I stayed in June of last year, but the system just allows this date. We’ve stayed here after being in the Middle East in very luxurious hotels. Also this was the first time I didn’t stay in Le Bristol in Paris. For the purpose of our visit (leisure), the location was extremely fabulous. We arrive very early, and we already knew the room was going to be ready, but received all our stuff. Also found the dinner reservations we arranged with the concierge before arrival were ready. We bought tickets for the Louvre at the hotel. This is good, as you skip the long lines at the famed museum. Of course Le Meuruce is in walking distance. We stayed through AMEX Platinum. I didn’t know if I received an upgrade, but the room was nice and comfortable. The bed was ultra comfortable. Also cleanliness was a strong point. The décor was very French and elegant. The toiletries were good too. The layout is not the typical hotel layout, but made us feel as in an apartment. Breakfast is different from the major European hotels (including major European hotels) as it is not buffet. They have two versions: continental (bread basically) and American which is the continental plus eggs. It is very tasty and high quality. Breakfast is served at their luxury restaurant and in an informal setting. We preferred the formal one, more comfortable. During our stay we had a couple of bumps: a missed wake up call, problems with a reservation and a rude waiter. At the moment I found this unacceptable at a famed ultra-luxurious Paris jewel. However we complained each time and were heard. Actually, once the manager of guest relations apologized in persons and sent delicious macarons to the room. After a year, and because of my job (at the factory), I understand that if you have 99% of great service (impossible in an industry to reach 100%), you’ll have trouble with one of every 100 guests. I guess we were than 1%. Also, after a year of being in all kind of hotels and complaining (not five stars of course), when they hear you are not happy, not everywhere seem to worry and do something. So, when you do something wrong and try to make for it, is something that –although expected- should not be granted. So now I’m fully able to appreciate the extra effort. The only thing I would change is the toilet in the room. Usually this kind of hotels has a bidet, but is understanding they don’t because of the size of the room. To compensate this, they could have TOTO (or Japanese) toilette. Then a bidet would be totally unnecessary. After all, if I went to Paris again, I would consider staying here again happily.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Spot for Tea in the Lobby”
Reviews.Author: junebug40
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay at this hotel... I only visited for tea, so I can't speak to the rooms only the lobby area. I'm putting my review here because I didn't want it to be confused with the very famous & elegant restaurant in the same hotel with the same name. While the service was painfully slow the food was very nice & the surroundings were truly lovely. The sandwiches were good, but the pastry was great. However, as good as it was there are plenty of spots in Paris full of wonderful pastry. I would recommend it if you are looking to see the inside of this famous hotel & the beautiful murals all around you. Plus as a bonus you do get to relax & try lots of little tasty desserts.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice renovation in line with the low-key /chic spirit of the classic that it once was”
Reviews.Author: oliviercale
Reviews.Content: As a Parisian who now lives in the US but still stays in hotels in Paris evey once in a while when not staying at friends' s homes, the newly renovated Meurice is a timeless success:it has been updated in 2008 with a twist that is not only in keeping with the spirit & legend of this Parisian classic but also adding to the institution that it once was. If you are going to stay there, get a room overlooking the Tuileries.Go to the new restaurant but the bar is nice too.Good international crowd, helpfull & sensible staff, central location, great views, what's not to love...Maybe a great Spa/gym & pool are the extras that would make this hotel a Top 5 Paris "Must stay"...?

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel room will not be back”
Reviews.Author: Myrnaman
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, but the people that work at the hotel are not nice at all. Very rude and not helpful, the concierge was not able to help me once on the five nights I stayed. They sent us to a restaurant that if I had to bet was owned by his brother. We had some 3 pajamas 2 shorts and 2 shirts and a couple of my items sent to laundry, no dry clean and the bill was 661euros !!! I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Exudes class and sophistication”
Reviews.Author: Londoner016
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel and I was very surprised at the standards of service and accommodation. This is a beautiful luxurious hotel that really deserves a much higher tripadvisor ranking. Having briefly visited George V, I must say that Le Meurice exceeds it in terms of its decor, ambience and elegance. Most interestingly it boasts a ceiling piece by Philippe Starck's daughter inspired by a former resident, Salvador Dali. The rooms are cosy and elegant - this hotel exudes old aristocratic French style. One of my favourite hotels in London is the Dorchester and as a sister hotel, Le Meurice is perfect. My only minor critcisms are the local area - which can't be helped - many tourists pack the walkways making it difficult to get out (although this is compensated by being close to the lovely Tuileries garden). The other minor gripe is the price of drinks which is really exorbitantly expensive and the lack of choice regarding breakfast. However, the plus points do really outweigh the negative points and if I am in Paris again, there is only one place to stay:- Le Meurice! (I've read the criticisms regarding the internet which American guests appear to be obsessed with. Frankly, while on holiday, the internet is the last thing you should be using, but that's just personal taste. I prefer to explore rather than sit in front of a screen all day)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but does not quite justify the price”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTraveller123
Reviews.Content: It's a wonderful hotel in a great location, but at the prices (500+ euros per night) you'd really expect a tiny bit more. The room, which I believe was already an upgrade, was still on the small side, although the bed and bathroom were first rate. The concierge service was fantastic - made reservations for us, found out about opening hours on 14th July etc. I can never get over why Wifi is not free in these places and so it was here: 20 euros/day (mind you, in Paris, not even starbucks has free internet...) and the minibar prices... The lobby was just a little but odd: you have to walk through groups of coffee tables to get to the lifts. These are all niggles, but at this price there shouldn't really be any niggles, I feel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: trio509
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights during July in a superior double room. Our only complaint is that there was an additional 24 euro charge for one days wi-fi access (roughly £21 per day at the current exchange rate) which given the price per room per night feels a little bit like money grabbing. At these prices surely this should be a pre-requisite for any luxury room? However the basic spa facilities were included and the gym was well equipped. The room was lovely and well presented and the hotel staff could not have been more helpful, nothing seemed to be too much trouble. American breakfast was superb, very filling and the service was extremely impressive. The hotel location is brilliant for sight-seeing with the Louvre but a 10 minute walk away. Overall a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DuffnGuff
Reviews.Content: Top class hotel, rooms a touch small but an entirely magnificent setting.

Reviews.Title: “Illusions”
Reviews.Author: Advourner
Reviews.Content: Le Meurice is adequate, but nothing more. I'm shocked by some of the glowing reviews, but I guess when you are paying those kind of rates, you will your conscious to believe that you are getting something special. I have stayed at some truly memorable properties throughout the world and this was not one of them. Pros: Very clean and well maintained, comfortable beds, fabulous water pressure, wonderful high ceilings compensating for the small square footage Cons: poor lighting in the room, no USA channels, no free wi-fi (major issue, future deal breaker), repeated room readiness delays at check-in (they basically string you along for hours), no non-revenue areas to relax in the lobby (either you're in the bar or the restaurant), rooms need a fresh coat of paint and new carpeting, basically nothing to do at the hotel itself, drinks outrageously expensive. At these prices, I expect pristine conditions and unflappable service. My expectations were not even approached.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and hope to be back one day”
Reviews.Author: lisalane23
Reviews.Content: We took our family to Paris for the first time and stayed at Le Meurice. It was a beautiful hotel in the perfect location. It was right across the street from the Louvre and within walking distance to terrific shopping, restaurants and sights. The rooms were large, updated and well-appointed. We were even able to get connecting rooms with our children. I also felt that the room rates were reasonable. They rooms are more expensive if you want views of the Eiffel Tower. The food at the Dali restaurant was delicious and the bar had just the right atmosphere and decor. The only thing that I wished was different was the breakfast at the Dali was good, however, there were very few choices and the service was slow. Also, if you wanted the internet in your room, it was expensive. The concierges were helpful, but they definitely acted as though they were better than you. There were tons of doorman always ready to catch a taxi or open a door. There were celebrities staying at the hotel which we were able to see as an added bonus. We felt pampered and comfortable. I would recommend the hotel to anyone, whether you're traveling with a family, alone or on business.

Reviews.Title: “One of Top 10 in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Animal70
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Le Meurice at least a dozen times on business. Rooms are very spacious, clean and bright. Location is excellent. The lobby is interesting both in terms of decor and liveliness. Room service is good, but the prices are outrageous. Staff are very friendly. This remains one of my favourite places to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service, gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Weevbinthere
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Le Meurice in April for 5 days. This hotel is beautiful in every aspect. We received some of the best service we have ever experienced in any hotel. The hotel is meticulous. 5 stars all the way, every hotel should be trained by these guys. From the decor, the service, the cleanliness- they know how to do luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Very, very, nice indeed”
Reviews.Author: dutchguy2
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a weekend in Le Meurice and were very impressed with almost everything. The staff was wonderfully friendly and helpful (and, as someone else mentioned, nice to look at!); we were especially impressed by the bar staff but the rest (at reception, the concierge, the porters and in the restaurant were very nice as well), The room was small, and the bed too, but beautiful with a great view (we were lucky enough to get an upgrade) and the bathroom had all the modern conveniences one would expect from a five star hotel. Also, the location is, of course, second to none. I do have one, major, gripe. Paying what we paid, not throwing in free Wifi is surprising, but also charging for the use of the business centre internet boggles the mind and needlessly detracts from the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great view”
Reviews.Author: DocPaulinLA
Reviews.Content: This is how a hotel should be. Elegant and with good service. While quite pricey, hey, this is Paris and you can't ask for a better location. Arrival was a bit mucked up...I had booked the arrivals service with the hotel which should have included a greeter at the plane door to help you through customs and with luggage and then on to your car to take you to the hotel. Nobody was there...including the driver. Now I can't blame the driver as there were some major accidents and the hotel was gracious enough to take it off the bill. We did play room roulette a bit...booked a garden facing room but it was a smoking room so they put us in a courtyard room and then into an incredible suite overlooking the garden...and the Seine, the tower and the Louvre. Absolutely lovely. Breakfast in the morning is great...the restaurant is absolutely beautiful as is the food and service (especially if you are first in...hey, I was here to work). While the stay at the hotel was not flawless, I felt that they handle the problems well and didn't just give excuses. While very pricey (and I didn't book at a discount either) I felt that the hotel was well maintain and the staff were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: traveler2too
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and wonderfully located. However, we had mixed results with the staff. About half were helpful and friendly. The other half just plain rude. I had asked for an early check in as we arrived at 8:30 am. Our arrival was late and we got to the hotel at 10:3o am instead. At that time, they said they'd try to get an early room for us. We were told we'd have our room by 12:30. We waited in the lobby, which is gorgeous. Unfortunately we were supposed to meet family for lunch and figured 12:30 might still work. However, we got into our room at 1:30 instead. I had the feeling they really didn't speed up getting the room ready and rather it was just lip service. How long can it take to clean a room? Perhaps I'm a little tough here on them. It was just a feeling. The room was comfortable, gorgeous and the marble bathroom stunning. We had high tea in the lounge. Service was great. The tea and sweets very so-so. Wi-fi is not free at about 30 euros per day. I find that a bit odd these days especially since this appears to be a business traveler oriented hotel. There is a business center but that runs 30 euros for 30 minutes. As I was attempting to get the attention and help of the one of the concierges, dot an easy thing to do apparently, there was a gentleman who needed to use the business center. The center was closed and the concierge would not open it for him. It is literally right next to the concierge's desk. The guest said he always stayed at the Meurice while on business and that was often. The concierge suggested using the business center at the Westin across the street. Well, I can tell you, I would stay at the Westin on my next business trip if I were that person. You can't beat the location of this hotel, but there are others on the strip that are just as well located. Across from the Tuilerie Gardens, near the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, L'Orangerie, Place de la Concorde, etc. But I'd stay at another hotel due to the hit and miss attitude. The French are the French, but when I'm on vacation and paying good money I prefer to be with friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “my kind of grand palace hotel”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: Le Meurice is my kind of ‘grand palace hotel’. The decor is period and stunningly beautiful, and it avoids the chintz and frills of many of its rivals. The highlights for me are the gorgeous bars and restaurants. We had the good fortune to stay in a beautiful suite on the floor just below the penthouse, and thoroughly enjoyed the views of both the Eiffel Tower and Sacre Coeur from our (small!) balcony. There can’t be many better ways to experience Paris than this! Le Meurice thoroughly deserves its 'hot pink' rating in the neilsonparc Lust List.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Charlotte
Reviews.Content: Usally staying at the Meurice for business but its location is perfect when on holidays as centrally located just in front the Jardin des Tuileries and walking distance from Le Louvre, Opera, Grands Magasins,... It has everything you can expect from a five stars hotel but i do not rate it in my Paris top 3 (Georges V is much better). And with new competition from Asia coming this year (ShangriLa, Mandarin and Peninsula) i am wondering how it is going to keep its turf ....

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: julylo7
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Meurice. The first time was wonderful; it was two years ago. This time the stay practically ruined the trip. Despite the fact I paid in full before even checking in, they charged my card erroneously and then did not apologize when the charge wasn't reversed for days. There was no personal attention and the last straw was when I had to hail my own taxi out in front of the hotel when there were a group of doormen just standing there chatting. Shockingly poor service and a newly corporate feel. Can't wait to return to Paris and stay at a hotel where they appreciate your business.

Reviews.Title: “In a word: perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Meurice for our 25th wedding anniversary trip in April 2011. We stayed 7 nights. The hotel was amazing, it was the perfect location to start each day exploring Paris. Our room (632 - junior suite) was excellent. It had a sitting room with couch and two chairs and a bar. The bedroom was large with a balcony where we could see the Tulleries Gardens and the Eiffel Tower. The walk in closet was large and the bathroom was marble with a large tub, walk in shower and two sinks. The bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet ( we slept past noon one day!) The room was not ready when we arrived at 9:30 am from an overnight flight, HOWEVER the staff was very helpful and accommodating. They recommended we cross the street and visit the gardens - they also have museum passes ( skip the lines) and we went over to the Louvre. Once our room was ready the front desk staff person took us for a hotel tour and when we ended up in our room, our luggage was arriving at the same time. Our room rate included breakfast which we took advantage of a few of the mornings. It was very good and the choices were easy to make. The bar was a people watching area and one night we had a great conversation with one of the bar tenders. The hotel management obviously takes great lengths to train their staff as every staff member we encountered was accommodating, charming and made sure we were happy before they left us. We used room service once and it was prompt, hot and elegant. The wake up calls were on time and personal. We recommend this hotel highly to all who ask. In a word: perfect

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: AnnM_7
Reviews.Content: Le Meurice is a great hotel with top-notch service. The concierge (Pascal) was excellent and it made my week-long stay in Paris extremely enjoyable. We arrived very early in the morning, and although the room was not yet ready, we were able to use their spa to freshen up. The room we stayed in was also spacious and very comfortable. This is a first class hotel with first class service. I would definitely stay here again the next time I visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and SO French!”
Reviews.Author: Darb1961
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful, wonderful hotel this is. My partner and I shared three wonderful nights here. We were so pleased to be able to access our room in the early morning, after arrival from Hong Kong and following our flawless chauffeur transfer and charming, handome reception (do they recruit their staff on looks?). I'm always conscious that early check-ins are never guaranteed so, after a long flight it was such a joy to be able to shower, change and explore the 1e district. Our suite was luxurious as expected and our lunch in the restaurant delightful - if somewhat overchoreographed!! Overall, this is an expensive hotel but my measure in all things is 'value for money' and in this respect, Le Meurive delivers the goods superbly.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary”
Reviews.Author: WharfTrader
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night on way through Paris - Quick check in - Tried to upsell me room, and showed me a room that stank of smoke - i refused so showed me another room which was exactly the same - pointed out this was the original room that i booked and wasnt going to pay the extra, which they agreed - though i get the feeling if i said nothing i'd have had to pay extra anyway - Not cool - so stayed in non-smoking room with no view (but very quiet) - Room itself nice (stayed in deluxe room) - comfy bed, lots of closet space, nice TV - huge bathroom with powerful shower, nice amenities Bar 228 very nice, as is hotel lobby - as with other guests they were unable to get me a table for dinner in any of their own restaurants, which is very poor - ended up eating at the bar itself - very pleasant staff, particularly for a Parisian hotel! - food good, but it should be given the price - breakfast next day was superb, in the main again thanks to the friendly staff - be sure to eat in the dining room, stunning space Superb location in the city centre, close to all the major attractions and great for shopping - lots to see and do in the area - try Carrs pub around the corner from the hotel for a quiet drink Overall quite good, but frankly not good enough for the money (and i have an uneasy feeling about that upsell) - as mentioned by another contributer, this is the wrong hotel if you are on an economy drive - indeed, its the wrong city! - come for a drink whilst walking around - though for me i might try another 'luxe' hotel on my next trip

Reviews.Title: “Poor Concierge Service”
Reviews.Author: Porthos77
Reviews.Content: I have reservations to stay in May and had asked the concierge to make reservations at several very popular restauants in Paris that are booked several months in advance. I received a response saying that the restaurants only take reservations 1 month in advance and that they will try to book them for me later. This is completely untrue since I am very familar with the restaurant reservation policies. I called the restaurants myself and was able to secure a reservation for 1 of them. The other two, I confirmed that they take reservations exactly 60 days in advance. I will probably cancel my reservation since what is the point of paying such a premium when the concierge can't even make a simple restaurant reservation. In comparison, Hotel Balzac was able to secure my dinner reservations after 1 email on my last stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: saphie9999
Reviews.Content: I thought it would be a great hotel and it is not. The first night we arrived we were told there were no reservations to be had at any of the hotel restaurants. I said well we were hotel guests and how could that be – they were not interested. Our room whilst a suite was small and cozy – not what we expected for the money charged. Concierge was helpful, but restaurants recommended were not that great and were somewhat pushed on us even when we told them this is not what we wanted i.e. vegetarian restaurants etc. This is not a hotel I would ever consider returning too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: Cardiff_Jeff
Reviews.Content: We were picked up at the airport and whisked through the diplomat exit which was very impressive. The hotel is superbly situated within walking distance of all the attractions of Paris. Our room which was a Classic room overlooking the Jardin des Tuileries with the Eiffel in the distance was with out doubt the cleanest and best furnished I've ever stayed in. The public areas are kept clean and are beautiful. The bar is superb, the food excellent and the service was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT”
Reviews.Author: bking7
Reviews.Content: highly recommended. Will stay again. wonderful staff. food was first class.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location, but things can get complicated”
Reviews.Author: eye82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night during a business trip to Paris. Room and bathroom were large, clean and just very luxurious. So no complaints here. However, in the morning I wanted to check out first and then grab some breakfast. So i asked the receptionist to put the breakfast charge on the bill. I was told that there were different types of breakfast (continental and american) and as she didnt know which one I would take she wouldnt be able to put it on the bill. Even though I told here I would go for the continental breakfast, this seemed to inconvenient her and I even got the impression that she didnt trust me. She then tried to call a waiter at the restaurant, but couldnt reach him. I decided to give up, checked out and had breakfast at a nearby cafe. I think this is unacceptable. I have never had this problem before during any of my business trips and I stayed at hotels not as prestigious as the Le Maurice. In addition, it is also overpriced. My colleague had a cup of coffee for €10. Yes it is Paris and a 5 star hotel, but €10 feels like a rip off, dont you think? So overall, a very nice hotel, but things can get complicated where there is no need to.

Reviews.Title: “Le Meurice Magnicant!!”
Reviews.Author: Anna121299
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Meurice last week - very expensive hotel (more than the Ritz) but an excellent choice!! Beds were very comfrotable, staff were attentive and polite, and drinks at the bar were brilliant. I LOVED the location, right in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “As long as I can afford it, I will continue to stay here”
Reviews.Author: asantiago2004
Reviews.Content: hotel was simply amazing...pricey, yes, but it is worth it...fun to see all the creme de la creme of paris hang out by the bar or having breakfast...staff was extremely corteous, except for the security personel, who kind of stared us down a bit (I complained)...but that was not going to ruin our 4day stay...the guys from madagascar that play the piano and bass are true musicians...i recomend that you take your wife / partner and have dinner on top of the piano, while the musicians play your favorite tune...(we stayed there closer to the first part of november 2009, not december like the caption says....

Reviews.Title: “Surprising standards of service”
Reviews.Author: LelianlePauvre
Reviews.Content: The Meurice has a lot going for it. Its location cannot be beat; neither can its comfort, room service, amenities, etc. It may be a little too new world rich for the taste of some, but that's a minor quibble for what is otherwise an excellent hotel. I was however shocked by a particular event, which must reveal something deeper about the way the staff is trained here. I'm clearly very young to be staying in such a nice place (25 years old). However, I believe I have never acted like this is anything less than a HUGE blessing - I have also been brought up to think this. Furthermore, I have EARNED this, by working week in, week out at ridiculous lengths - my stay at the Meurice came after a year without a single day off, including week-ends. This stay was my way of taking my girlfriend for something special, for some quality time which we both (very) badly needed. So for a room service waiter to tell us, after he has brought us our dinner, and received a tip, with a sarcastic smile, "merci mon grand" ("thank you my good man") created more than a slight ripple effect in my beat-up body. That he should feel authorised to judge that I had been offered this trip by some rich parent (my parents are not rich, nor would they ever dream of giving me anything like this if they were) is bad enough. That he should go on to express it, and with full sarcasm to boot, completely took my breath away. I should have reacted in anger, but the significance of what he said took a good 20 seconds to sink in. Now that it has, my decision is made: I'll be taking my business elsewhere in future.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go Mince infested Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jodenice
Reviews.Content: Only went for drinks last weekend in the Bar. Regular Hotel bar with cocktails and eye watering $30 per cocktail plus service charge. Paris is expensive so expect high prices. However what I didnt expect was the mice running around... So if you happy spending $150 for 4 mojitos in a mice infested place, this is for you. If not I'm sure you'll find loads of better places in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Lovz2Travel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely well situated. The public areas are kept clean and are beautiful. However, the service is extremely bumpy. We experienced being picked up at the airport and being brought through the diplomat line (which was quite amazing). We experienced some very lovely people (Sandrine at breakfast, and 2 young gentleman who worked the concierge). However, many of the older people working thimmedientlye front desk and concierge most of the time gave us wrong information and sat around bored and unenthusiastic. While some people really did go out of their way to make us happy, others did the complete opposite. For example, I had requested foam pillows and when I got to my hotel room they were not there. I called housekeeping who said it would be taken care of at turn down. I come back to the room after turn down and still no pillows! I waited 3 hours (or until 2am) until they found the only foam pillows at the hotel. The next day when housekeeping came to clean my room, they took away the foam pillows and gave me down again. The room seemed worn with many spots on the furniture and carpet. I would also like to add in while having a few drinks in the bar, a mouse was running around on the ground. While although some people were reseated to another room, more should have been done. I would never expect a mouse to be running around at a 5 star hotel. Drinks and food are extremely overpriced. I only recommend this hotel due to its location.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Excellence and Beauty”
Reviews.Author: rbf9956
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Le Meurice a few weeks ago and the staff could not have been more helpful. In contrast to the experience of many Americans travelling in Paris, we were welcomed and served beautifully at this hotel. The front desk help was fantastic and in fact every person who worked at this hotel was friendly and eager to serve in any way they could. The facilities are beautiful as well, of course! An expensive hotel, but worth the cost in experience and beauty!!! And the location is fantastic as well-walking distance to many of the beauties of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “terrific all around”
Reviews.Author: lauromso
Reviews.Content: We recently celebrated my husbands birthday in Paris and stayed at Le Meurice on the advice of friends, having never stayed in that area of Paris before. We normally like to be on the Rue George V. However, I am now hooked, not because the location is so easy and central to everything, but because the hotel staff are superb. No attitude, anything we needed.. no problem. All our questions were answered with a smile and great advice. I was very impressed with the whole picture, and I'm very picky! One issue... the closets are tiny, tiny.. almost a joke. Could only have been designed by a man. They will bring up a rack for clothing if asked.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again - I gave it two shots ... my return was a disaster !”
Reviews.Author: AVPDOR
Reviews.Content: The Meurice is very nice but unfortunately suffers from keeping up a real 5 star level of service. I love old Palace hotels - especially in Paris. A hotel which is very nicely renovated, lots of charm but the suites are very small - especially - when the GM knows you from her previous job were you are used to stay in large suites and presidential suites and then you are put in a small suite ... it makes you think. (and they knew it was our kind of honeymoon) After complaining they put you in the Presidential suite which is cold and not personal at all .... and then the Lobster club sandwich came.... it was sent back .... and why can a room service breakfast not be delivered as it was ordered .... to summarize, Le Meurice is very expensive for the quality and service it offers.... conclusion ... After leaving the Crillon, my home in Paris for many, many years and staying 5 times in the Bristol - which I would call the world's worse 5 star hotel - I will return to my beloved hotel De Crillon - trying to forget that it belongs now to Starwood Capital .... my hopes are high that their new experienced GM will make it as pleasant as it was until my last stay there in 2007.

Reviews.Title: “A real palace hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellingKoalas
Reviews.Content: So many hotels will call themselves palaces, but only all small number would truly deserve this distinction. The Meurice does, and in my view may even be the reference to which other such hotels would need to keep up with. My wife and I use to favour the Plaza Athenee, but splendid as it once was, it is now sadly going downhill, with many of its rooms and common areas in need of refurbishing and service sometimes uneven. Not so when you enter the Meurice. From the bustling and noisy rue de Rivoli you enter a safe haven, a sanctuary of elegance and grace, with many warm smiles to greet you. The friendliness of the staff seems genuine, matched with a perfect balance of professionalism. You feel you are being taken care of from the very start and up to the last minute of your stay, as it should be in such an expensive place. The entrance hall, foyer and common areas are worthy of a historical chateau, but not stuffy in any way, and immaculately clean, even fragrant. The top floor junior suite we were given was in a word splendid, offering uninterrupted views from its little balconies, of pretty much every single monument that Paris has to offer. The fabrics in the room were of the highest quality, and furnished with classical great taste. The bathroom with a large window was the best I have ever seen in a city hotel. Room service was perfect. So to summarize, every ingredients are there to create the perfect blend of what a top parisian hotel should be like, more so than the four-seasons, a bit too corporate style, or any other grand establishement I can think of in Paris. The Meurice obviously enjoys a well deserved success as unfortunately it was fully booked when we tried to extend our stay. We just didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in Every Way!”
Reviews.Author: PCOH
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 7 day stay at Le Meurice. Even though the hotel was full booked (as was all of Paris that week) everything was perfect! Our room was beautiful and very spacious! I was staying with my son who had been ill, so we took full advantage of the services. The front desk and concierge staff were so nice and helpful all of the time. Room service was great and prompt, and available at all hours. We used the laundry and everything was beautifully laundered and returned promptly. The Dali restaurant is delicious and a great people watching place. The hotel is in a fabulous location, is incredibly elegant but also fun! It was an oasis in a big city. Everyone knew our name and could not have been more helpful even though the hotel was totally full. Our room was upgraded immediately when we had a slight problem with our air conditioning system, and the staff moved all of our luggage and belongings so it was totally painless. I would highly recommended this hotel among the other luxury hotels in Paris, where I have also stayed on other occasions.

Reviews.Title: “unfair restaurant review”
Reviews.Author: RoboColorado
Reviews.Content: I just looked up the Meurice, where I have stayed twice and will be staying again in September. I saw a negative review of the restaurant, and proceeded to read it. I then noticed, it is from 2005. The first review of Le Meurice is dated 2005!!! Not fair! I don't want to be judged by who I was in 2005 and I don't think we should judge them by 2005. Doesn't Trip Advisor cull old reviews? Not feeling the love and wouldn't trust your reviews based upon my most recent experience. Come on..... that's not fair.

Reviews.Title: “where else would one stay?”
Reviews.Author: difficultGuest
Reviews.Content: when spending a week in my beloved city with my children, i of course chose a suite at Le Meurice, confident that we would be at home from the first moment. of course, this is precisely what happened. we lived there for a mere week, but to this day my children insist that cook try to recreate their pain perdu (which she valiantly assays, but sadly comes up short.) leave aside the obvious: the location on the Tuileries, the new Starck décor (which perfectly brings the hotel's history into the present,) the restaurant, the charming sand-board for graffiti, the impeccable service. these things are expected. what remains with us is the sense of being at home, and this is a function not of price but of the heart. Le Meurice in every detail has the heart of a warm and enfolding home, and we will of course return to our suite and feel as if we had been away from home for a few days only. my grandfather stayed there in the 1890's, my Mother in the 1960's, and i expect my children to continue the tradition in the decades to come. ici, il n'y a rien de décevoir le connaisseur.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, elegant hotel but poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: whirlwind79
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently and am not unused to good hotels with prices to match. The Meurice is in a great location and the decor is very elegant with crystal chandeliers and all the hallmarks of an expensive (and good) hotel. The prices, however, are beyond expensive - €20 for a glass of wine at the bar (and that was the cheap stuff!). The room itself was quite small, and the biggest problem was the air conditioning: there was a little unit on the wall that controlled it, but there was no temperature setting. All I could control was the strength of the fan on a scale of 1-4. Despite it being 30C outside, the room was freezing and the biggest problem was when I was in bed as the air shot out towards the bed (even on the low setting). Overall a nice hotel but there is better value for money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Romance in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sav83
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at Le Meurice in June. This was a special occasion where I planned on proposing to my girlfriend. From the moment we set foot in the hotel, we were greeted by politely by all members of staff and kindly shown up to our room. As this was a romantic weekend with my intentions to propose, I organised in advance the 'Romance Package' which included roses, petit fours and champagne. On arrival in our room, the roses were in place and within about 5 minutes of being in our room the champagne and petit fours arrived - mmmmm fantastic! We stayed in a superior room and it was comfortable and roomy, the bed was extremely comfortable with nice linen. The bathroom was lovely, and we lost count how many times the maids came in to service the room. The hotel is very chic and the decor is exquisite. Some previous comments suggest the hotel may be snobby or staff to be rude. We didnt experience this at all, the attention to detail was really something special. We ate breakfast both days in the main le meurice restaurant and were very well looked after by Benjamin - who was very friendly and took time to explain to us some local attractions worth visiting, nothing seemed like too much bother for him or for the rest of his colleagues. We also ate at the 'Dali' restaurant which in our opinion was really very nice indeed. Steak to die for!! And the deserts were amazing too! We had 3 courses each and a bottle of wine and it came to about £220. In the scheme of things was worth it, as a one off treat. During our visit, we also popped down to have a sauna and jacuzzi and to our surprise the place was deserted so we had the place to ourselves! For people like us, the whole experience was really a special treat, we like to stay in nice hotels but cant always afford luxury to this extent. For me, it was worth it, and we were made to feel very special throughout our stay. Staff quickly picked up our name and always addressed us by it - very impressive. Thank you to all at the hotel who made our stay so special, we do intend to come back...maybe for our anniversary! If anyone has any questions, I would be happy to answer... Oh and she said 'Yes' :-)

Reviews.Title: “Most heavenly bed!”
Reviews.Author: Oatibix
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Meurice when we travel to Paris. We love this place for its location and impeccable service and the most wonderful beds. The rooms can vary widely in size and design. There have been some junior suites that we have stayed in that are much better than others and features are not always standard across the same class of rooms. The standard rooms are small but overall service is good. Having said that, the beds are all uniformly AWESOME. Plush yet firm, comfortable and great high thread count sheets and most comfortable pillows of any 5 star hotel bed. (It's a personal thing but I really hate these down pillows that clams towards your ears and crowd your face. It feels so suffocating. btw, if you love down pillows, you can ask for them. ) The hotel restaurant - Le Meurice - a MIchelin 3 Star, was one of the most beautiful dining rooms we've been. It feels almost a little over the top at first glance but it has a modern touch once you settle down with different chairs for some tables. Both the food and service were really impeccable. The waiters almost gliding on glass like a choreographed dance . In general, they were young, international and fun. (unlike some other 3 star michelins where service can be overwhelmingly stiff and that you feel that you have to straighten your tie before eating). I've never felt so relaxed in other Michelin 3 Star restaurant. Breakfast is served in the same room. It's good but really rather standard breakfast fare. We definitely would stay here again( and again)!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, horrible concierge”
Reviews.Author: BostonBoy01y
Reviews.Content: Recently spend 4 days In this Hotel. I'm a frequent traveller and no stranger to pricey places and usually don't mind when the service is to match. My wife went and got her hair blow-dried, a service that was advertised at 80 euros and we ended up with a bill for 350, supposedly because more services were performed (not true). The concierge was completely unhelpful and downright standoffish. After a lengthy back and forth the Hotel agreed to take the charge off ONLY THEY DIDN'T upon check out the charge was still on there and I was giving the old 'manager isn't around and nobody is authorized to fix it' routine'. They made the token gesture of capturing my email address and promised resolution, never heard from them again and we are now disputing this through AMEX. In addition the place nickel and dimes you at every corner... Simply an aggravating experience that overshadowed the whole trip

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant”
Reviews.Author: VoyageDublin
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris for 2 days on a business trip and my Company had booked me at Le Meurice Hotel. Beautiful, elegant, glamourous and I had just the right service. I want to bring my wife because I'm sure she will love the attention to details.

Reviews.Title: “Snobby”
Reviews.Author: media47
Reviews.Content: We stopped by Le Meurice Hotel for a glass of champaigne. They would not allow us itno the bar or the tea room (because we were not staying at the hotel. (My husband and I are in our early 60's and were well -dressed). The service was quite snotty and neglectful. They sat us in the lobby right where hotel guests walk to catch the elevators. Though there were crystal chandeliers and gilt trim, the white couch they had us sitting on was stained in several places. The waiter handed my husband the credit card receipt to sign, but did not stay long enough to collect it; my husband bravely went into the mostly empty bar to hand it to one of the waiters standing at attention in the mostly empty bar. It was our least pleasant experience in our 12-day trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: talkative
Reviews.Content: I would happily recommend the Hotel Meurice (with a couple of reservations) & we would stay there again. We had a truly lovely time. We stayed in a deluxe room for 2 nights booking the Romance Package ie bed & an american breakfast every day, flowers in the room. champagne & petit four. We got the package for less a night than the rack room rate. Our welcome and treatment in the hotel by all staff was charming. We ate lunch in the Le Meurice restaurant - a memorable meal in a lovely room. The staff were great - skilled, relaxed & warm. The food was excellent & the wine recommended was superb & a long way from the most expensive available. We also ate in the Dali where the food was a little more casual but the atmosphere was very pleasant & the staff were also very nice. Our room although newly renovated was dull & not roomy - the bathroom was huge. Unfortunately, our room had a connecting door with another room on both sides. The sound proofing was fairly good but at this price & particularly if we'd paid the rack rate of 900+ euro a night I don't want to hear someone else's noise. An upgrade was not offered (it was suggested as a possibility at the time of booking & on the website ) but they did seem busy. The flowers listed in the package were not in the room & when my husband spoke to the guest service director they immediately sent up a lovely bouquet. There was also a problem with a simple room service order - corrected immediately & with charm. We were given a late check out which was much appreciated & very useful as our train was after 5pm. We spent, with the room & the grand lunch & a casual evening meal, a great deal of money. If you can afford it as a matter of course or if like us you can budget for it as part of a special occasion then go to Le Meurice & have a lovely time. I wouldn't recommend it if you were going to be stressed about the money - everything costs a fortune - 9 euro for a small bottle of evian in the room - 26 for an ordinary sandwich - 20 euro for a 1 days wifi. But to be honest these prices seem standard at this level of hotel in Paris. However, this level of welcome, charm & pleasantness is not standard. We had a lovely stay & we would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Eating at Le Meurice”
Reviews.Author: Foredeckcrew
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a day trip to Paris to take 2 clients for lunch at Le Meurice. We have all travelled extensivelly and eaten well. This was the best meal I and my clients have ever had, the staff were amazing, the presentation superb and the wine delicious......A memorable experience and one I will never forget. Bravo to Le Meurice! I have them to thank for a wonderful day.

Reviews.Title: “Paris really is an international City”
Reviews.Author: Helenblack123
Reviews.Content: the hotel is near Louvre. It is a smaller hotel with about 150 or so rooms. Wonderful accommodation and staff. Great restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance in Paris”
Reviews.Author: zenery
Reviews.Content: Talk about the premiere hotel in Paris and it is the Le Meurice. From the arrival to our beautiful suite and during our impecable stay, oh la la! Manifique! The service was impeccable and our suite was so comfortable and immaculate. The amenity was a thougthful gesture and appreciated. The restaurant was picture perfect., food was delicious and the wine was superb! Absolutely charming, romantic, plush, elegant, beautiful and the best hotel in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but lacks customer service skills”
Reviews.Author: everygirlever
Reviews.Content: I loved Le Meurice asthetically. I had issues with the staff and their inability to manage problems. A guest in one of the rooms above us smoked out our entire room with his hookah smoking and it was coming through the venting or something (could never truly get a full explanation from the staff so I'm assuming this is how it got into our room). It smelled terrible and literally filled our room with smoke yet the staff refused to allow us to change rooms and they refused to inform the smoking guest that his smoke was entering our room. They had to be asked repeatedly to even investigate why our room was filling up with smoke. I actually had quickly packed our bags out of concern there might be a fire. In the end, we had to just tolerate it because it was late and we were leaving the next morning. The staff never seemed to appreciate us as guests and the vibe I got from them was that I wasn't particularly welcome. It was really kind of odd. I was shocked that we were paying hundreds and hundreds of dollars per night and here I am feeling like the kid at the party your mom made you invite.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: seanbee
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for breakfast one morning and were shocked by the lack of service and hospitality on offer that day. The staff didn't seem to know what tto do wiith two people who were not guests coming for breakafast.¨Plus,while not unfriendly, they just didn't seemend bothered. We entered the lobby and had to look for someone to direct us to the restaurant. This lovely sunny morning we passed the ground floor restaurant which seemed dark and dingy compared to the sun outside. Breakfast? If you have 40 euro to pay for pain au chocolat , coffee, juice and some bread, then this is the place for you. If, like us, you would expect a treat for this price and know that there is so much betterr in Paris, then stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Handle Problems Very Well”
Reviews.Author: newyorkanya
Reviews.Content: When we've stayed stayed at the Meurice before it was fantastic and so we were very happy to be be put up there again on a recent working trip to Paris. The staff are very helpful, the breakfast is great, the location is unbeatable and the bar and restaurant are beautiful. But this time around we had a couple of small problems and I noticed they couldn't really cope. The first was that there was some kind of renovation going on so I was woken up by really loud banging at 10am the first morning I was there. I didn't complain as it was quite late in the day but the next morning it started at 8am. That is 2am NYC time so I was pretty unhappy but when I called the front desk they were totally useless. They said they didn't know where the construction was happening and that it couldn't be in their building. (Then they said someone was putting up curtains) They later called me to discuss it and that woke me up again, even though I had the "don't disturb" sign on my door. Not sure why the noise was such a mystery to the front desk and manager. The housekeeping staff was on the floor and heard it too. No apology, no free fruit basket, No note. No explanation. Nothing. Not what you expect in one of the finest hotels in the world. The second problem was that there was a cold snap and we had no heating in our room for two days. We called and they sent someone to our room (which always seems to be their response. They send someone who can't help and then he has to make follow up calls) but in fact it's all managed from a computer somewhere. So I don't quite know why they didn't notice it to begin with and why they couldn't just fix it without having to send someone. So not disasters but not the seemless incredible service one expects. My only other comment is that the prices have gone up for food. Sandwiches are now a staggering 25 euros! We ate dinner at the hotel restaurant one night which is very arty and modern. Ate at Guy Savoy a couple of nights later and thought it was one of the best meals ever.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Mmmnnn
Reviews.Content: Just spent two days at Le Meurice and it was perfect - the ambience, welcome, service, decor was top notch and the room (one up from standard) - while small - was beautifully appointed, the bathroom ravishing in detail and luxury. Have stayed in many hotels around the world and this has to rate in the top 3-5.
