Just a couple of small details to note - but they were not off putting. 1) Check in is at 3, but the room was not ready at 4 when I arrived - they offered a comp drink but I wanted the room! A few other posts here mentioned the same, thing - they haven't got their turnaround right - but just ease into it / expect it - and take them up on the drink or tell them you're checking out late! 2) 20 euro per day internet access - come off it guys! If you're selling me an 800 euros a night give me wifi!!! I know when I'm being taken advantage of - and this annoyed me more than the room not being ready. Guess I'm cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Stuffy and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: mmuller2
Reviews.Content: Okay -- maybe I'm not the kind of person who should have stayed at this hotel. I'm young-ish, modern, and while my husband and I can afford to travel nicely, we certainly don't need to spend money for the sake of spending money. On the positive side - this hotel's location could not be beat -- we walked to many places - including the Louvre and the high-end shopping district. The hotel was also decorated beautifully. Our room was beautiful and spacious. However, while our bathroom was nice -- the shower was built in a way that water flooded the bathroom everytime someone showered. In addition, we felt that for the price we paid for the hotel, we did not find the service exceptional at all. Drinks in the hotel lobby were so expensive that we sat down, looked at the menu, and then passed. Now, we are people who eat at nice restaurants and understand that food and drink in nice places, especially in vacation destinations, can be pricey -- but even we were shocked. We looked at the price of alcohol and thought "okay, maybe we'll stick with hot chocolate or a milk shake." Then looked at those prices and just got up a left. Overall, while the location was amazing and the hotel beautiful, we spent a ton of money and did not feel comfortable in our own hotel or even feel like we got much out of it. An expensive mistake that we will not repeat.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Luke20
Reviews.Content: My fiancée and I have just come back from a night at Le Meurice. I work in the hotel industry and more pecisely in the high end segment. To be honest, the Meurice is far better then all the hotels where I have been working and surely the best we have ever stayed in. This trip in Paris was a surprise for my girlfriend, since I wanted to propose to her. When we arrived to the hotel we were greeted by a professional and elegant door staff. Once inside...wow...the hotel was beautiful and the atmosphere, due to a mix of traditional opulent elegance and modern touches, was fantastic. Reception was professional and every aspect of their behaviour reflected a top smart attitude. Not sure if it was genuine kindness or "leading hotel one" but for sure it was faultless. We were upgrade to the Marco Polo Suite and, as soon as we entered the room, we remained without words for some minutes: the room was big, elegant, very frenchy, with an open space including sitting room, bedroom and bath. Ten minutes after our arrival in the room, a bottle of complimentary champagne was delivered. Not the common Moet but an elegant (yes again) bottle of Louis Roederer. Every detail in the room was top notch. You got the impression that they choose the best for everything: Penhaligon toiletries, 5 kinds of waters and 4 champagnes in the mini bar, excellent room amenities and fantastic ambience fragrances in all the public areas. Since I am a passionate of hotels, I am always very critic against hotel services but here everything, really, was top. Concierge, especially Sam, and Adeline at reception worth a special prize. For sure the hotel is expensive, even if we got a very special deal. But you are in a masterpiece of French hospitality, steps away from the best Paris has to offer. So, even if you are not a billionaire and once in your life you want a Royal experience, then go to the Meurice and you won't be disappointed. I will recommend the hotel to all my guests going to Paris and look forward to going back soon!!! PS: my girlfriend said YES!

Reviews.Title: “Worth it, specially if you get a discount rate!”
Reviews.Author: RodrigoHueb
Reviews.Content: Many people complain that the location of this hotel is not the best, as it is in Rue de Rivoli, famous for its popular souvenir shops and low budget cafés. In my opinion, location couldn't be better, walking distance from the Louvre and Place de la Concorde... so you could reach mostly anywhere of interest in Paris in a few minutes. I got a special rate booking online well in advance at the Dorchester site. Stayed in a Deluxe room which was fairly big and had all the amenities expected in a 5 star hotel. The Phillip Starck decor was really nice, with a nice classic touch.. not being too over like the Faena Buenos Aires. Haven't really tried their Michelin Starred Restaurant, as I am not really into spending a fortune on food (I do like fine dining, but I eat too fast to enjoy an incredibly expensive meal hehe) . The service in the hotel was not exceptional at all... in fact it was inexistent... I asked front desk to help me track a lost suitcase and they didn't even bother contact the airline carrier. Funnily enough, the most helpful and nice person in the staff was the bellboy, always smiling and ready to help, apologizing all the time when something was out of his reach. I have noticed from past experiences that ometimes higher staff in luxury hotels need to learn some lessons of humany with the lower ranked employees. Do I recommend this hotel? Yes, definitely. Would I stay there again? Probably not. Would like to try other famous Parisien Palaces, like the Ritz, Crillon or Four Seasons. After all, Paris has a lot to offer in terms of accomodation!!

Reviews.Title: “Best room in town”
Reviews.Author: hgeslin
Reviews.Content: Le Meurice offers the best room in Paris. I stayed there severals time and each room have their own style and decoration. The bathroom are also superb and very spacious. The service offered is fantastic and the food is to die for. Try the breakfast in the room you won't be disappointed. The two restaurants are excellent, the Jardin d'hiver offer very good value for money and the 3 Michelin star is a myth in Paris but you need to book well in advance. My favorite palace in Paris by some margin.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Grande Hotel on a street of tourists”
Reviews.Author: 22club58
Reviews.Content: A grande hotel of classic service standards and some of the highest prices in Paris. Service is outstanding and the hotel staff seem genuinely pleased to interpret your need in advance of your knowing you have a need. In particular the Concierge staff is outstanding and was able at the last moment to secure the most difficult reservations. Although convenient to the Metro, the location is dissapointing being on a street with heavy Louvre directed tourist traffic and shops that supply tourist trinkets. Because of the service, an experience not to miss but other Parisian hotels offer comparable service in a better location at no higher prices.

Reviews.Title: “A STAY YOU WILL NOT FORGET”
Reviews.Author: abw75
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best. From the moment I left the taxi to enter the hotel to the moment I departed the hotel for the aiprort.......I was treated like a queen. This hotel is on the top of the price range, but worth every euro. The gentleman who greeted and assisted us at the reception personally showed us to our room. I had never had service like that in a hotel before.

Reviews.Title: “PASS”
Reviews.Author: caughtthetravelbug09
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Meurice in June and you could not drag me back there. The lobby is very attractive as is the breakfast room. The guest rooms are decorated in that over the top, gauche style that must have looked dated as soon as they finished the renovations, and now just looks tired. The bathroom however was very nice. The headboards smell as if cigarette smoke has been baked into the very fibers of the fabric. We arrived at 10AM and were not given some of our rooms until 7PM. We were given one room immediately upon check-in, but shortly after we moved our luggage into the room, three men knocked on our door and began to repair the TV for a few hours. So much for showering and changing while we waited for the rest of the rooms. We had not asked for rooms near each other or made any special requests as far as the location of the rooms, so I don't know what the hold up was. We were all exhausted having just arrived on an 8 hour flight, and wanted to at least change and freshen up. When we finally did check in, one of rooms had not been cleaned and had half drunk bottles of alcohol with cigarettes in them. So much for getting the non-smoking rooms that we requested. My room was on the 2nd floor in the middle of a construction zone. There were jackhammers going non stop, so they very graciously moved me to a smoking room, and after I complained about that they moved me to another room, which was fine. I was just floored that they would make us wait for 9 hours to check-in. I understand that we arrived early for check-in, but we still were brought to some of our rooms 4 hours after regular check-in. To me waiting around for an entire day to check-in is inexcusable. Never was an apology issued by management for what happened, nor from the person checking us in. On a side note, the location is not my favorite in Paris. While it is near the Louvre, it is overrun with tourist shops selling t-shirts and magnets. I would not recommend this hotel. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Elegance. The superlative service makes up for the physical inadequacies”
Reviews.Author: hanyu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Le Meurice for an extended weekend getaway. I have stayed at the George Cinq, Ritz and De Crillon and my review compares Le Meurice with these. Firstly, Incentives: 1) The hotel has a great location with great views. On the Rue de Rivoli, opposite the Jardins du Tuileries and diagonally across from the Musee Louvre, it has an excellent location, with the Tuileries Metro stop less than a 5 minute walk away, 20 minutes through the Tuileries will put you past the Place de la Concorde and along the Champs Elysee. Shopping is on the street behind, with Rue St. Honore and the Place de Vendome round the corner. Arguably, for view, the De Crillon has a more enviable position right on the Place de la Concorde but the Meurice came in a close second, certainly trumping 4 Seasons George Cinq and the Ritz. 2) The bathroom was generously proportioned (stayed in a superior room), with twin sinks and a clean, refined, modern twist on Louis VI design. 3) The in-house restaurant is superlative. A bit of a foodie, I try to take in the new recommendations by locals and Michelin (a reliable guide for french food) and was not disappointed by the eponymous restaurant. It is everything a 3 star Michelin should be: elegant, attentive service and excellent food with an element of creativity. With more and more fine establishments appearing on the scene, 3 stars isn't just about service or doing a traditional menu well, there must be more. There must be creativity with cuisine and Le Meurice delivers. 4) The service is absolutely the best I've ever had at an European hotel. Bar none. Friendly, cheerful but respectful, the Meurice has got it right. The George Cinq was too large a hotel for the staff ratio and felt impersonal and perfunctory; the Ritz and De Crillon were abysmal with snotty, bad service for those who are not completely fluent in french (I'm capable of basic conversation but not much more at this point in time). Even my french speaking friends from Montreal say the snobbery in these 2 hotels was insufferable, almost as if you should feel grateful for them "letting you" stay there. But the Meurice was warm, everyone attempted french first but smoothly swapped to english if you weren't following or looked lost. Though they only do that to those who look or can speak a bit of french I'm told. Otherwise, fluent english all the way. The housekeeping service could not be flawed and was always smiling and polite. The concierge was somewhat solemn faced but very polite and efficient. Not the best, but certainly not marring of the experience by any means. Discentives: There was only 1 that stood out really. The rooms were very tired looking. Unfortunately the pictures you see on the website do not at all correspond to what you get at the Meurice. The photos taken by some other contributors are a far better bet. Even the colour scheme of the rooms are different from the images on the website. Unfortunate for a hotel that was supposed to have undergone fairly recent renovation. If one has to, the fact that the toilet was not in its own enclosed alcove, was another point. But this is a very old establishment in a historic city. Most such places will not have the spacious bathrooms with alcoves etc. like you'd get in say New York or Tokyo. But the shower is separate from the bathtub. Don't scoff, you'll be amazed how luxurious this point is in old European cities. All in all, for the price (5 star famous Parisian hotel category), Le Meurice gets the highest marks amongst the lot from me. I was made to feel welcome and comfortable and would definitely recommend this ahead of the George Cinq, Ritz or De Crillon if you are booking a standard or superior room. If you are booking a suite, the Ritz, George Cinq and Plaza Athenee are top bets for your money.

Reviews.Title: “One of the very best in the World”
Reviews.Author: k-myers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Paris for 2 nights on our way to Normandy for the 65th anniversary of D-Day. We had recently read in Conde Nast Travelor that the Le Meurice was rated one of the top ten hotels in the world so we decided to check it out. We were not dissapointed! We booked a lower rate [--] and were expecting an inner room with a view of the garden. When we arrived they upgraded us to a balcony suite overlooking the Rue de Rivoli and Tuileries with a great view of the Eiffel Tower and Louvre. Beautiful room with an ihome clock. We ordered room service and it was in our room in less than 5 minutes. We enjoyed a great meal with a great view and our our own favorite music on our ipod that we plugged in to the rooms ihome. The hotel is in a perfect location in Paris, There's a metro across the street but most sites are within walking distance. The concierge even managed to get us reservations at the highly sought restaurant, Jules Verne, atop the Eiffel Tower with only 4 hours notice. When we went down to the lobby there was a taxi already waiting for us. My wife and I have been to many of the top 100 hotels in the world but this was the best. You simply must stay at this hotel at least once in your lifetime!

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but not fab.”
Reviews.Author: acmes
Reviews.Content: We were traveling through Paris--on our way home--and decided to splurge on Le Meurice. The connecting rooms hit all the marks for luxury and being well-appointed. The staff was very kind and welcoming. For a hotel of this level, I would have expected some of the finer points to go more smoothly. We arrived at the usual check-in time of 3pm--we were somewhat bedraggled by transportation logistics. Unfortunately one of our rooms would not be ready for an hour and the other would take an additional two hours. Since we were only staying one night and hoped to make the most of our time in the city, we ended up wasting a lot of time. I didn't appreciate paying 20euros for internet service--especially when everywhere else we stayed provided it for free. On our departure the bellman took nearly 30 minutes to collect our bags and deliver them downstairs to our waiting taxi. Personally, I'm not crazy about the location--yes, the Louvre is steps away, but so is every tourist-kiosk selling t-shirts and geegaws. Not much of real Parisian life here.

Reviews.Title: “Your Perfect Right Bank Address”
Reviews.Author: travelmikeVancouver
Reviews.Content: Hotel le Meurice has been on my "Bucket List" for decades, and I recently had the opportunity to stay at this historic gem. It was six days of perfection, and not only met but far exceeded all expectations. Things started off a bit rocky. We arrived before check-in time and were told our room would be ready soon. We had a very long wait, however, due to an unexplained "technical difficulty" in the room we'd been assigned. We were exhausted after an unpleasant 9 hour flight. After a few hours hours, the Assistant Desk Manager appeared to smooth our ruffled feathers, and from this point on everything ran like clockwork. We were invited to relax in the gorgeous Bar, and were served endless glasses of fine Champagne and delightful nibbles, all "on the house". Our room was finally ready by 5 p.m., and what a room it was! Completely wood-paneled in shades of cream and butter yellow, it had an enormous entry hall with a perfect bouquet of tiny white tulips placed by the door on an antique reproduction table. There was also a well-stocked minibar, and off the foyer were two doors. One lead to a huge, gorgeous bathroom. Double sinks were set into a slab of grey marble, which also surrounded the enormous bath tub, six feet long with a waterfall spout and hand-held shower spray. There was also a very large walk-in shower, and the toilet and bidet were in a separate area as well. Everywhere were piles of thick, blindingly-white towels. The bedroom itself was perhaps a bit smaller than we expected, but extremely quiet and comfortable. The king bed was heaven, and across from it sat an antique desk, above which a flatscreen TV was mounted on the wall. There was a small table adorned with a beautiful orchid and 2 small chairs in the corner. A set of double-paned windows looked across the rue Castiglione to the Westin Hotel, and when closed they muffled all city noise beautifully. We could not have been happier. Room Service breakfasts are expensive and worth every penny. Fantastic coffee, an elegant carafe of fresh o.j. and a terrific assortment of fresh rolls and pastry are served on fine china and linen. You'll be offered many delicious tiny jars of preserves and spreads from Fauchon, the famous gourmet shop not far away near the Madelaine. The stewed prunes I ordered arrived tipped with real gold leaf! This was just one of the special little touches that made our stay unforgettable. The hotel's location cannot be topped. The Louvre (and Tuileries metro stop) are an easy stroll down Rue de Rivoli. Up the road are the Grand and Petit Palais,where the former currently has a fantastic Warhol retrospective. Around the corner from the hotel is Place Vendome, and just beyond that is the Opera and easy access to world-class shopping. The famous Faubourg St. Honore is close by, as are the enormous department stores au Printemps and Galeries Lafayette. There are many bars, cafes and restaurants within easy reach, including Angelina Tea Room virtually next door. There are 2 restaurants within the hotel; le Dali and le Meurice. le Dali functions as a lounge (and really part of the lobby as well). We found the most entertaining thing in all of Paris was to sit in le Dali, order a $30 cocktail, and watch the comings-and-goings of the rich and famous. The clientele is generally chic and connected and we loved guessing which Broadway star was sitting by the piano bar, and if that young waif might be a supermodel cozying up to a rock star in the corner. By all means do not miss enjoying breakfast in the drop-dead gorgeous Restaurant le Meurice. Enormous chandeliers,gleaming marble floors, a frescoed ceiling and polished silver await you here. A Michelin-starred chef also serves up some numbingly-expensive lunches and dinners. There is a lovely Spa onsite. You'll be welcome to use it at no charge, a real rarity in a hotel of this calibre. When we stopped in the place was almost empty. There are dry saunas, a "hammam" (steam room) and delightful Jacuzzi here, as well as a small patio and a well-equipped workout room. Service was flawless, from Doormen to Housekeepers, there is a feeling of quiet efficiency and discretion throughout. I would not consider staying anywhere else on the "Rive Droite". It's all here, it's all superb, and we felt we received the very best value possible in pricy Paris.....we paid 380 Euros per night (the rack rate on our door quoted 880 Euros), and it was absolutely worth it. le Meurice is truly special in every way, and I cannot recommend it highly enough. If you can, DO!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, but not the best value”
Reviews.Author: Cdn_traveller10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one week of our honeymoon in a junior suite about 400 sq ft- half of which was the most impressive marble bathroom I've ever seen! Needless to say there was barely room to turn in the "suite". The service was very nice and thoughtful. For instance, we were greeted with a bottle of champagne and a note for best wishes in our new life. The location of the hotel is amazing, our balcony offered the most fantastic view of the Louvre, palaces and gardens as well as the Eiffel Tower. The consierge staff were very courteous and helpful in arranging last minute reservations for restaurants and travel. Travellers are advised to keep abreast of extra charges that may appear on the overall bill. We were charged hefty tabs for dinners and drinks that did not belong to us. This, however, was cleared up immediately by staff and management once it was brought to their attention. Overall, great location, great service, but painfully small rooms. Without question, "not" the best value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious splurge”
Reviews.Author: FrenchFiona
Reviews.Content: We went to France on our honeymoon for 12 days in May. We stayed 3 nights in Paris, 3 nights in Loire Valley, then back to Paris of last 5 nights. We wanted to stay in a luxury hotel for our first three nights in Paris, so our French travel coach booked us at Le Meurice. We got a Deluxe room, and it was amazing. Very beautifully decorated, and the most comfy king bed with luxury bedding. The bathroom was huge, gorgeous, and all marble. It had separate toilet & bidet room, separate huge shower with multiple shower heads, dual sinks, and deep tub. The view was overlooking the Tulierie gardens behind the Louvre. The staff was wonderful; every staff member knew our names and greeted us every time they saw us. They even knew who we were when our taxi arrived on the first day, before we even introduced ourselves! Very impressive. We had breakfast there in the casual restaurant; it was delicious. I would love to stay there again if we decided to splurge on luxury hotels again in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “top hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: firstclassflyer007
Reviews.Content: i was in late november at le meurice , it is a fantastic hotel , i dont know why the bad reviews , what expect from a high class hotel? ,it isnt cheap of course, we usually stay at ritz or four seasons , this is at the same level or above. Made our reservations thru amex platinum travel they honor us all the special amenities,brfst included, was amazing, dont expect the american buffet, it is a la carte ,top service top quality, coffee and tea incredibles. The hote is after a two years of renovations a new gem for paris , made it by Starck , the renovation it is a succes, because mix the equal of story ,elegance and modernity and style. Room Big ,spotless, spacious and elegant, its biger even the american average ,there is a foyer with a reception bar and minifridge full of bottles and little treats, of couse again its expensive, and again you stay at one of the best hotels in paris,the bedroom with top class sommier, frette linens, robes and slippers, of course lcd tv , dvd and free internet in room. Bathroom A chapter for itself, glorious , big enough . All in white carrara marble , floor to ceiling all you must see is marble , new and polished two sinks separates tub and shower and the toiletries are from penhaligon s london, towels from turkey, excellent. If you can spend one dinner at dali , the hotel restaurant it is one of the four in paris it have 3 michelin stars chef, outstanding all, very fist class. Dont think more go to this hotel , believe me you remembered all life , and enjoy paris !!!

Reviews.Title: “We always stay here”
Reviews.Author: Robin91
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Meurice for the third time in May 2009. Its just gorgeous. Staff are helpful (amazing in Paris), rooms are grand and make you feel like Louis XVI, the Philippe Starck renovation has been sympathetically done and modernised the reception areas without losing any of the charm and romance of the place. Large bathrooms. Breakfast was very good, what a wonderful dining room. Food at their less formal restaurant also excellent; bar is fun but sophisticated and not intrusive. Our four year old needed a doctor on Sunday evening of a bank holiday weekend and the hotel produced a good doctor in short order which was impressive. Good room service. Opposite the Tuileries is a good spot and moments from the Place Vendome and 5 minutes from the Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “A let down”
Reviews.Author: cheuk
Reviews.Content: Blame the reviews. I planned long and hard for my 5th anniversary. Having spent hours researching, I finally decided upon the Meurice. Partly due to the rave reviews, the Starck interior of the lobby and the promotional prices. I really should have been vigligant of the discounts as they appear to the only hotel in this price range offering promotions at the time of my bookings. Location - yes, it is a short walk away from the Louvre and the Metro. But along the busy Rue de Rivoli there are also tacky souvenir shops and other lesser hotel establishments. It is far less grand than the surrouding areas of the Athenee, Park Hyatt or the Ritz. Rooms - I booked a Grand Deluxe room. It was gloomy without much natural light. The room was a long elongated shape so i feel as if i am sleeping on a corridor. The TV clearly was an afterthought as it was 2 ft above the sofa and there is no way you can watch it from the bed even if swiel it to full angle. The windows overlook a 'courtyard', but it was sparse and plain (nothing like the courtyard at Ritz). Disappointing. House keeping was most disappointing, used cups were never clean or replaced (i stayed for 4 nights). Items of clothing went missing and never found (hotel offered me a reimbursement - but still it should have never happened in the 1st place). Requests for hot water were forgotten. the TV and modem did not work the first time. The niggles that happen at this hotel alone were more than those from other trips i have been to added together. Had breakfast at Dali. 50 euros per person. Guess is the norm for Paris but it is nothing spectular. I also had dinner at Meurice. Medicore for the price ($220 euros per person) On next trip, i may try the Plaza Athenee.

Reviews.Title: “One night, one dream”
Reviews.Author: PrincesseCapucine
Reviews.Content: I spent only one night in this hotel and it was one of the most wonderful moment I ever lived! The staff was extremely caring and full of consideration despite the fact we were obviously not regular customers - and they never made us feel like that. We were just like kings :o) Of course, the place is full of luxury, fullness, even the cocktails are subtles. Till the eggs at Breakfast that are specially cooked a different way every day. We simply were in a different world, out of time and reality. One night is so short (we did not test the spa, neither the gastronomic restaurant) but maybe it is better like that. Would it be still magic if we get used?

Reviews.Title: “A perfect trip”
Reviews.Author: john500
Reviews.Content: My family usually travels to Anguilla for spring break, but this year we decided to spend the break in Paris. My wife, daughter 13 and son 10 chose Le Meurice for our hotel, and we are so glad we did. Our rooms were large, comfortable, and always very clean. From the front desk to the concierge and housekeeping, the staff was always cheerful and helpful. Tres Bon!

Reviews.Title: “great location, great staff, worth the price”
Reviews.Author: JPatek
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Meurice for one week after staying at Marriott Village d'Ille-de-France (see other review). Le Meurice is centrally located near many of the major museums and near two Metro stops. If you use the Metro, you can easily reach any of the tourist attractions inside Paris. I have very briefly described my thoughts on various museums, attractions, and restaurants. Le Meurice - Check in was a breeze, front desk staff was friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The rooms are comfortable and spacious for a European hotel room. We opted for a courtyard view since these rooms are quieter than rooms facing Tuleries Gardens. Housekeeping was efficent. In fact, my daughter wrapped one of her stuffed animals in the bath towels, after we returned from sightseeing we made a frantic call to housekeeping and voila, housekeeping found the toy within 15 minutes. I wonder how many bath towels they had to rummage through. Absolutely no complaints regarding the hotel except prices in the minibar, bar and the restaurant. Breakfast is very expensive compared to the states (continental breakfast is 36 Euros). Water in the minibar is 9 Euros. Vodka martini in the bar is 25 Euros. Service was outstanding and the hotel well worth the price. I would highly recommend this Hotel. Paris Museums - They are all fantastic. Don't believe Froder or Frommer's when they state you can view the Louve in 1/2 days. To do the museum right you need more than one day. For the Louve we went on a Wednesday at 0930 and bought our tickets at the Carrousel du Louvre entrance ( the Carrousel du Louvre is a collection of shops with an entrance to the Louve - enter on Rivoli, the same street that Le Meurice is on); there were no lines. Your ticket allows you to return if you go outside of the Louve for meals. The Louve after 1800 was virtually deserted. Musee d'Orsay can be viewed in 1/2 a day. The restaurant in d'Orsay had great french onion soup some of the best we had in Paris. For military and history buffs don't miss the Musee de l'Armee or the Museum of the Legion of Honour and the orders of chivalry (next to d'Orsay). The Museum pass is OK if you plan to see all the museums over a set number of days, but since we were there for two weeks, the pass was not in our best interest. Paris Churches - Notre Dame is of course a must see (especially do the tower tour) but if you can make it to Cathédrale Notre-Dame de Chartres (Cathedral of Our Lady of Chartres) make the 50 mile trip. Chartres is not as commercialized as Notre Dame and read up on its stained glass history. Sacre Cour is also impressive and has great views from its tower. St Chapelle, one can sit for hours viewing the various stained glass. Arc de Triomphe - is a great place to view Tour Eiffel especially at night when the Tour Eiffel turns on its blinking lights. Great history surrounds the Arc so a must see for history buffs. Catacombs - Safe, easy to get to, and alot of bones. closed on Tuesday. Berthillon - good ice cream but not the best in the world as stated in some tripadvisor reviews. The Salted Caramel is overrated but the black chocolate was fantastic. Galeries Lafayette - most prices are higher than in similar stores in the states at least that's what my wife and daughter tell me. Cheap Eats - L'As du Fallafel - fantastic fallafel and shawarma. Welcome Cafe - down the street from Le Meurice great cheap (by Paris standards) food. Many other great places to eat and see. Places to Avoid - We had poor service /attitude in two locations - Carmine and Cafe Rivoli. Driving in Paris - the city itself is crowded for driving but not any worse than driving in New York City, London, Italy, or any other major international city. Drivers are aggressive but I found more willing to let you change lanes in town than in my home town Chicago. Definitely fewer horns than in any major US city. When driving on the highways remember the left lanes are for passing not loitering like here in the states. Regarding the stereotype that the French especially Parisians are rude: this is false. Just attempt to speak French even just Bonjour and au revoir, Remember in Europe it is customary to greet the shop owner/worker and saying thank you or good bye when leaving the shop or restaurant. We don't speak French but just attempting made the vast majority of our interactions pleasant. Remember the impression you give will either reinforce or create new stereotypes of the American tourist.

Reviews.Title: “very romantic and just a gorgeous place to visit”
Reviews.Author: IrelandPoppy
Reviews.Content: Piano in bar just won us over after a long day and tHe service and evening menu was very pleasant. Interior is sucH a pleasure to absorb and its in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Action023
Reviews.Content: It’s not very hard to find Le Meurice a beautiful hotel. Both public areas as well the rooms are extremely beautiful and sometimes even stunning. On top of this the hotel restaurant (also called Le Meurice) offers you a 3 Michelin Star experience that is pricy but absolutely belongs to the best restaurant in the world Why then only 2 stars ? Simply because if you look trough the facade of beauty, the basic hotel needs (housekeeping, roomservice, etc) is lacking, once in a while poor and the sense of hospitality is missing. Attention to detail is missing and management is reacting extremely arrogant to guests needs of complaints. Despite the request for a quiet allocation we ended up in a very noisy room that constantly went on. We barely slept. Beds are extremely firm and leaves you with heavy back pain. Request for a softener was ignored and afterwards it seems the hotel does not have such. Hotel prices are extraordinary. Expect to pay US$ 15,= for a Coke and US$ 40,= for a Club Sandwich. Pressing of a shirt is US$ 20,=. For such prices you would expect nothing left to care for but Le Meurice fails to fulfil at the end. For the same amount of money, there better options in Paris. I would not consider Le Meurice once more for the future.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best city hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: lulu383
Reviews.Content: There's probably not much that hasn't been said already, but Le Meurice is one of the loveliest hotels we've visited--and by far the most relaxing and luxurious in Paris. My husband and I spent six days there last month and loved every minute of it. The staff went out of their way to predict and accommodate our every need. I walked through the front door holding a bouquet of flowers, and tI was immediately approached by a front desk employee who asked if he may cut them, place them in a vase, and have them delivered to my room. Another time, I asked the front desk to recommend a place we could buy a cheap curling iron since the different voltage had fried the one I brought. The gentleman looked at me in horror and said, "Why, we should certainly have curling irons here. You needn't spend your time in Paris looking for something like that. It's our mistake for not thinking of it, but please, allow us to find you one." An hour later there was a brand new curling iron in our room with a note of apology for the delay. They had gone and purchased a bunch on their own to keep on hand for guests in the future! Our room was lovely and the bed the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever experienced. Every day we were surprised with a plate of different, amazing pastries. The lobby was a great combination of chic and comfortingly traditional and great for people-watching. My only complaint was the astronomical cost of food--28 Euros for a club sandwich in the bar--but this is Paris and it's to be expected. Overall, we will gladly return to Le Meurice.

Reviews.Title: “You could be nowhere but Paris and that's a good thing!”
Reviews.Author: TM99
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a weekend at Le Meurice and had an excellent stay. What I really appreciated about Le Meurice - as well as the superb, very personal service and perfect location - was that it felt utterly Parisian. Our "junior" suite had recently been refurbished (design by Philippe Starck) but it was the epitome of Parsisan chic - floor to ceiling windows, dressed by acres of luxurious drapes, stylish sofas beautifully upholstered, a large vase full of perfect roses. But the suite also had a large flat screen TV, a "his and hers" dressing room (4 wardrobes) that I wish I could have in my own home and an enormous marble bathroom. We were travelling with our 9 year old son and received a perfect restaurant recommendation from the Concierge for a local bistro that was more casual in style than the hotel's own 3 Michelin-starred temple to gastronomy (but we had a most enjoyable breakfast in there). On the Saturday evening we had a drink in the bar after our meal. It was very busy (no sign of credit crunch at Le Meurice) and had an excellent atmosphere. The hotel's public areas are not that large, but the hotel has a stylish and sophisticated feel, with consistent service throughout. All staff were helpful and keen to please. We really like the staff at the Dorchester Collection hotels and chose Le Meurice following a jaw-dropping stay at the Beverly Hills Hotel in the summer. We find the service really does go the extra mile and is less formulaic than at some of the other luxury groups. Anyone who has trouble with the service has got to be doing something wrong! Maybe guests should remember that they are in France, not USA and the service ethos is different but certainly not lacking here.

Reviews.Title: “le meurice , best luxury hotel in paris?”
Reviews.Author: namirus
Reviews.Content: i stayed 3 nights at the meurice on October 27, 2008 It wa sthe best experience ever Even better than the best asian hotels ( peninsula in hong kong, shangrila in singapore etc...)in terms of service , food and efficiency Let me explain: the concierge Sam is terrifice the best to get restaurant reservations, christophe the valet very kind, Souad resposible for the dali restaurant so p[rofessional The food even at the dali is over the top The breakfast luxurious but slightly expensive at $60 (no buffet) the rroms are luxurious a nd very well apointed The bath rooms beautiful The location is the best next to the Louvre and the place vendome The best luxury and service in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler11594
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meurice just before Thanksgiving in November 2007. The day we arrived in Paris a transportation strike had begun. It literally began the day we arrived--we had read about the impending strike the day before in the American newspapers. Luckily, the hotel had already booked someone to meet us at our gate. This person ushered us through customs, helped us retrieve our luggage and euros from the ATM and brought us right to our waiting car and driver. Thank goodness for that because there was no other way out of the airport! We arrived at the hotel in the very early a.m. and the staff was ready to greet us. We sat at the little desk in the reception area and they helped us through all of our plans in terms of museum tickets, etc.. We had planned to go to Versailles and also had made many restaurant reservations prior to our arrival. These were now in jeopardy because there were no taxis, trains or metro. The hotel was very helpful in ordering chauffered cars for us for everything. This was a huge added expense, but some of the pain was taking away by how wonderfully gracious they were in handling everything. Our room was prepared immediately and we were able to go in and rest right away. Room service was excellent, decor and cleanliness were top notch. Our view was of a courtyard which was as expected. The staff was friendly and helpful. When we had (many) technical problems with the DVD player and the stereo they came and replaced the entire system. The day we went to Versailles we were celebrating our anniversary and we returned to a lovely bottle of champagne with special treats. There are two wonderful things about this hotel: the location--can't beat it--and the staff. On our last day we were flying to Rome on an early (7 a.m.) flight. We had ordered the car for 4:30 a.m.. We came down, the car was packed and ready to go. As we were leaving, the concierge asked us if we would like him to confirm our flight to Rome. Guess what? The air traffic controllers at Orly had decided to join the transport strike. We were to be meeting some officials at the Vatican as we were renewing our wedding vows at the Vatican on Thanksgiving Day. The staff at the hotel literally got on the phone and started to see what they could do to get us out of Charles De Gaulle. They sent us back up to our room (free of charge) for hours while they booked us new flights. This saved our vacation. I have heard great things about the Four Seasons Georges V, but I must say The Meurice holds up in terms of service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Not a palace...”
Reviews.Author: chry98765
Reviews.Content: We chose the Meurice because we had herd it was one of the first palaces in Paris, and we have stayed at its sister hotel The Dorchester many satisfying times. Location is good. The hotel doesn't have very many rooms, but the lobby is way too small. It is basicly a combination of the reception, an entry way better known as a "couch", the casual restaurant, and the bar. It was pretty, but I guess it could have been better enjoyed if it wasn't so crowded. I know it is cliche to say that the Parisians are rude towards Americans. But I think it is more that they don't enjoy speaking english since they are native french. We were encountered many times with arrogant staff. I am not paying over two thousand euros a night to get a cold shoulder. The suite was nice. A deluxe garden view. It was small for the price, but nevertheless very nice. It was difficult to see the garden and the eiffel tower. If you do decided to stay here, don't pay the money for the garden view. Food: Restaurant Le Meurice was great. Great food and service. It will cost you about 400 euros with wine. If you are looking for star french cuisine, look at Ducasse. He is at the Plaza, and Jules Verne at the Eiffel tower (we had Jules Verne; the view was pretty, food bland). Funny enough, the best French cuisine we had on the trip (between Paris and London) was Ducasse's Restaurant at the Dorchester in London. Back to the Meurice...skip the casual restaurant. It had a boring menu and lazy service. This hotel is beautiful. However if you enjoy fantastic service at a hotel it truly can't recommend the Meurice. Try the Park Hyatt...its at Vendome and is an understated hotel. And you can't go wrong with the Four Seasons. We booked a driver through the Meurice to give us a day tour, and he told us that he also works for the Four Seasons, and that they "try to hard". We thought to ourselves 'well that can't be that bad because the Meurice isn't trying hard enough'....

Reviews.Title: “Tres fabuleux”
Reviews.Author: heleneast
Reviews.Content: An absolutely special experience of Paris. Supremely stylish, very swish, gorgeous bar, one of the best restaurants in France (and excellent value at lunch during the week).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Alexander1997
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations of Le Meurice given the cost but I can confirm these were exceeded in every way. We booked 2 de luxe adjoining rooms for 3 nights for me, my wife and children (13 and 11). These were courtyard rooms as I wanted peace at night and they were indeed very quiet. The rooms were well appointed, very comfortable and spacious. The bathrooms were opulent and spacious as well. The welcome was most unParisian-warm and helpful-nothing was too much trouble. There was always plenty of staff to deal with every query we had. The concierge staff were truly outstanding-we had a long list of things we needed and they were equal to the tasks in every way. Their restaurant recommendations were particularly good. We ate a number of excellent meals in the hotel including one dinner in the 3 star restaurant. The cost of dinner is eye watering particularly if you choose a decent wine but it is worth every penny. I've had a large number of meals in many top class restaurants but this has to be in my top 3 ever. My 11 yo son is still telling people his langoustines were the nicest thing he has ever tasted. Finally, the location is second to none-everything you need to see is within walking distance if the weather is ok. If Le Meurice can maintain these standards there really is nowhere else to stay in Paris-and I've been to the George V. One other point which you may find useful-don't bother with Angelina's next door. Despite allegedly having the best cakes and hot chocolate in Paris, it failed again (I'd had lunch there with clients last time I was in Paris) - noisy, poor quality cakes, awful service and expensive. We had Le Meurice's afternoon tea which was everything it should have been though pricey but worth it.
